Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) offer several advantages that are accelerating the research and development of the technology.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: Recent advances include the improvement of materials and new fabrication techniques, as well as new designs, flow configurations, and applications.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: The large scale implementation of fuel cells, especially in distributed energy generation, is limited by several factors-one of which is their limited fuel flexibility.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: Changing fuel typically requires modifying the fuel processing unit to make it possible to effectively convert raw fuel into hydrogen-rich gas.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: One potential solution allows for the use of alternative fuels without the need for customization of the fuel processor.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: This solution requires the adaptation of the stack to operate with direct internal reforming (DIR) of the fuel on the surface of the anodes.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: The present study explores the potential to internally reform methane in the SOFC stack with electrolyte supported cells.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: The numerical model that was developed for the simulation of the 1300 W stack was validated using experimental data obtained from partial internal reforming.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: Later, the model was applied to simulate the operation of the stack with complete internal reforming of methane.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: It was observed that the strong effects of internal reforming on the temperature in the outlets are visible when the current exceeds 22 A. However, it was proven that the DIR-SOFC mode of operation is possible in the considered stack without exceeding the advised temperature limits in the core, and in the outlets of the anodic and cathodic compartments.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model

Sentencas: The model was found to be accurate and the observed relative prediction error was in the range of 1.51-2.38%.
Titulo: Dynamic analysis of direct internal reforming in a SOFC stack with electrolyte-supported cells using a quasi-1D model
